ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sensorineural component attributed to cisplatin ototoxicity; conductive component attributed to Eustachian tube dysfunction secondary to radiation.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and Eustachian tube status.
To assess the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Bilateral mixed hearing loss, worse in the right ear. The conductive component is consistent with Eustachian tube dysfunction indicated by negative tympanometric pressure. The sensorineural component is consistent with ototoxicity. Speech recognition is moderately degraded in the right ear and slightly degraded in the left.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate rising to mild mixed loss (250-500 Hz) sloping to profound SNHL (1-8 kHz). Left ear: Mild sloping to moderately severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to profound (4-8 kHz). Air-bone gaps present in low frequencies bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 45 dB HL, WRS 62% at 85 dB HL. Left SRT 45 dB HL, WRS 82% at 80 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Excessive negative pressure bilaterally (Right: -105 daPa, Left: -130 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at 500-4000 Hz bilaterally.

counseling_actions: Counsel on the dual etiology of the hearing loss: cisplatin affecting the inner ear and radiation causing Eustachian tube dysfunction.
Explain potential benefit from hearing aids following medical management.

escalation.rationale_short: To address the mixed hearing loss and Eustachian tube dysfunction prior to hearing aid fitting.

expected_outcome: ENT specialist determined the sensorineural loss was due to cisplatin and the conductive loss was due to Eustachian tube dysfunction secondary to radiation.
Patient was referred for a hearing aid evaluation.
